text: The Mayor shall not expend any moneys borrowed for capital projects for operating expenses of the District of Columbia government.
historical:
Emergency Act Amendments

For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see ยง 4(d) of the Redevelopment Land Agency Disposition Review Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2000 (D.C. Act 13-524, January 11, 2001, 48 DCR 624).

For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see ยง 2(b) of the Redevelopment Land Agency Disposition Fiscal Year 2001 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2000 (D.C. Act 13-563, January 31, 2001, 48 DCR 1625).

Legislative History of Laws

Law 13-226, the "Redevelopment Land Agency Disposition Review Amendment Act of 2000", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-185, which was referred to the Committee Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 11, 2000, and November 8, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 29, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-498 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-226 became effective on April 3, 2001.

DC CODE ยง 1-301.77

Current through December 11, 2012

heading.catch_text: Prohibition on Capital Funds for Operating Expenses.
